abstract: Lilliam Barrios-Paoli, New York City's deputy mayor of health and human services who has led city's response to mounting homeless crisis, will step down at end of September; prominent departure comes at critical period for Mayor Bill de Blasio as he seeks to establish new homeless housing options before winter.
lead_paragraph: Lilliam Barrios-Paoli, the deputy mayor overseeing the city’s response to the homelessness crisis, will leave at the end of September to become the volunteer chairwoman of the board of the Health and Hospitals Corporation.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Aide on Homeless Is Resigning Amid Crisis
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Aide on Homeless Is Resigning Amid Crisis

snippet: Lilliam Barrios-Paoli, the deputy mayor overseeing the city’s response to the homelessness crisis, will leave at the end of September to become the volunteer chairwoman of the board of the Health and Hospitals Corporation.
